name: NPR
text:
Modelers say there's a trend of rising coronavirus cases moving northward from Florida "up travel corridors like I-95.‚Äù

name: NPR
text:

name: NPR
text:

name: NPR
text:

91 cases have been linked to a single nightclub in C√≥rdoba.

name: NPR
text:

A fourth suit may be coming from California's attorney general.

text:

text:

text:

text:

text: "Folklore," the surprise new album from @taylorswift13, tops our list of the week's best releases, along with new ones from @LupeFiasco, a 50th anniversary edition of @Roberta_Flack's debut album and more. https://t.co/wlLrC1tTsd

name: NPR
text:
As zoos across the country start to reopen, one curator says certain animals seem to have missed having people around ‚Äî but not all of them.

"We haven't seen the cats get super excited about seeing people," he says. "But that's honestly to be expected."

name: NPR
text:

name: NPR
text:
The power of workers ‚Äî to negotiate for better pay, benefits and working conditions ‚Äî has been in decline for decades. 

Harvard's @annastansbury talks about the drivers behind that decline ‚Äî and what it means for the economy.

name: NPR
text:

name: NPR
text:
Women rarely received credit for their creative work in Colonial America.  

But with a new album, one scholar is reviving the works of the women who lived and composed at the Ephrata Cloister commune.

name: NPR
text: The federal government has distributed billions of dollars in direct payments to struggling farmers and ranchers. But your favorite farmers market vendor probably hasn‚Äôt seen much of it. @harvestpm https://t.co/HXbZp4zLUD

name: NPR
text:

40 years later, today's Olympians share a bond with those athletes.

text: "If you aren't leading with your values, you're leading with politics and you're leading with things that don't acknowledge what kids just went through," one teacher says as school officials try to prepare for the upcoming academic year. (@MindShiftKQED) https://t.co/gJWAzbusq9

text:

text:

name: NPR
text:
Nia was 4 when her mother, Chalana, was sent to prison. Last month, she was finally able to come home.

On their first weekend together in 15 years, the two sat down to talk.

"You are the absolute one thing that I got right," Chalana said. (@storycorps)

name: NPR
text:

text:

text:
